channel.title: It work?
channel.description:
can i portforward like this: Start>Control Panel>Security>Windows Firewall>Allow A Program Through Windows Firewall(Side Menu)>Add Port and There I Call It what I Need And Port 43594 And TCP CHECKED
IT WORK? PLZ ANSWER FAST!

item.title: It work?
item.dc:creator: @magekid990 magekid990
item.description:
@magekid990 wrote:

From my experience utorrent has always TAKEN UP my 43594 port so i just had to router portforward. So from what I have done is Just asked my dad to give me the user and pass. BTw I know there is a Tutorial on how to portforward without changing the router settings.

Read full topic

item.title: It work?
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

Actually Dracule is right, that just allows incoming connections from that port. You still have to portforward through your router. Or you can use the uTorrent alternative which I don’t reccomend.
[/quote]

Meh, the uTorrent method may just cause a lil’ lag, but if you’re running a good enough PC it shouldnt be a huge issue.

Read full topic

item.title: It work?
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

[quote=“Word Life, post:6, topic:357572”][quote author=DraculeMihawk link=topic=454089.msg3325578#msg3325578 date=1283077888]

Yes that should work.

You are a moron.

He obviously has to PORTFORWARD in his router thats just allowing firewall to accept other internet connections from the port that will be forwarded.
[/quote]

Look at the Tutorial on How To Start A Server. The Soul obviously used McAfee which is a FIREWALL. Learn your shit before you flame. In fact, don’t flame at all. kthxbye?[/quote]

Actually Dracule is right, that just allows incoming connections from that port. You still have to portforward through your router. Or you can use the uTorrent alternative which I don’t reccomend.

Read full topic
